citations.narrative:
No records of acquisition were available for two green winged macaws, a scarlet macaw, and a blue-and-yellow macaw.
Acquisition and disposition records are necessary to be able to accurately track animals being used in regulated activities
to ensure their legal acquisition, proper care, and humane transportation. The exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning animals purchased or otherwise acquired,
owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his possession or under his control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or
otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his
possession or under his control. All information found within section 2.75(b)(1) should be recorded, maintained, and made
available for inspection. Correct by 6/18/2025.

On June 6th, 2025, a member of the public sustained a puncture wound on their hand from an adult ring tailed lemur by
the name of King Julien a.k.a. “Juju.” In the facility, the representative allowed Juju to approach the individual on a leash.
The member of the public was reassured that he did not bite. During the interaction between the member of the public
and Juju, a puncture wound was sustained on the individuals hand. The puncture broke the skin and she required medical
treatment. This contact can result in stress, disease transmission, injuries or even death to animals and/or visitors.
Correct by ensuring that animals are handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animals and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the general viewing public as to assure the safety of animals
and the public. Corrected prior to the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
No records of acquisition were available for two green winged macaws, a scarlet macaw, and a blue-and-yellow macaw. 
Acquisition and disposition records are necessary to be able to accurately track animals being used in regulated activities 
to ensure their legal acquisition, proper care, and humane transportation. The exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain 
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning animals purchased or otherwise acquired, 
owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his possession or under his control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or 
otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his 
possession or under his control. All information found within section 2.75(b)(1) should be recorded, maintained, and made 
available for inspection. Correct by 6/18/2025. 
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On June 6th, 2025, a member of the public sustained a puncture wound on their hand from an adult ring tailed lemur by 
the name of King Julien a.k.a. “Juju.” In the facility, the representative allowed Juju to approach the individual on a leash. 
The member of the public was reassured that he did not bite. During the interaction between the member of the public 
and Juju, a puncture wound was sustained on the individuals hand. The puncture broke the skin and she required medical 
treatment. This contact can result in stress, disease transmission, injuries or even death to animals and/or visitors. 
Correct by ensuring that animals are handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animals and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the general viewing public as to assure the safety of animals 
and the public. Corrected prior to the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
